newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila raises banks' dollar sales limit.
newsitem.headline: Manila raises banks' dollar sales limit.

text.p: The Philippine Monetary Board has increased the limit of banks' over-the-counter sales of dollars to customers to $100,000 from $50,000, Central Bank officials said on Sunday.
They said the decision of the board, the Central Bank's policy-making body, was part of the country's programme to liberalise the foreign exchange market.
